visualization_prompt: Generate a combination chart showing the relationship between mathematical functions and stochastic measurements using dynamic function plotting with synthetic noise injection
visualization_explanation: The dataset combines two mathematical constructs: 1) A deterministic sine wave (x ∈ [0,100], y = sin(x/10)) representing theoretical expectations, and 2) Stochastic measurements (n=1000 points) with uniform noise (±0.5 amplitude) added to the sine function. The synthetic measurement data approximates normal distribution (μ≈0, σ≈0.29) through Central Limit Theorem effects from summed uniform variations. The visualization employs Tufte's data-ink principles by maximizing the signal/noise ratio: 1) Semi-transparent small markers reveal density patterns without occlusion, 2) High-contrast theoretical line maintains visual precedence, 3) Neutral axis styling reduces cognitive load. Cairo's perceptual taxonomy is addressed through: 1) Position encoding for precise value comparison, 2) Color differentiation (blue=empirical, red=theory), 3) Interactive zoom for scale transitions. The dual-series design enables direct visual hypothesis testing of the mathematical model against noisy observations.
